author: Torrent_Studios
title: Cheap Jay minifigure foil pack
review:
Introduction

Whenever I have a spare bit of change saved up, I swing 'round to my local newsstand who are sure to have one of the latest issues of the Ninjago magazine. This month, I picked up the magazine with Scuba Jay.

The cheapest set that Scuba Jay appears in is 71752 Ninja Sub Speeder, which goes for $50, which is not a price I'm willing to pay, even if it does represent good value. However, I really wanted the Jay minifigure since I think it's the best Scuba suit, tied with Zane's, so I was really happy to now own a brand-new version of him.

Packaging

Very nice square foil pack, with easy-to-open edges like a chip packet's. The border design is some classic red Ninjago patterns, with a render of Jay in action, yellow-green lightning bursting from behind him. A photograph shows him off, equipped with all his accessories

Contents

10 pieces make up Scuba Jay, who comes with all the basic accessories of a Scuba ninja: a one-piece rubber scuba tank with rebreather, a pair of black flippers and a silver katana. Besides those, he also comes with a Lightning Harpoon, as advertised in the accompanying magazine. 

His torso is the most well designed in my opinion - a predominantly dark blue base, blue evenly distributed across said dark blue, dark bluish gray straps, and a touch of flame yellowish orange accents to spice things up. I'm a huge fan of this design.

No instructions come with this foil pack, which is usual, but none are really required for only a minifigure.

Overall opinion

I really enjoy a cheap way to obtain Scuba Jay, so this foil pack is perfect for me. I'm hoping to obtain Benthomaar, Glutinous and Scuba Nya, all of which are confirmed to be featured in future issues of the Ninjago magazine

 

Thanks for reading, hope you found this review informative and helpful.
